arm_group.description: Stryker Accolade hip system prosthesis components

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the use and efficacy of the Iconacy Hip System for
      total hip replacement surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Market Study of the ICONACY Hip System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  This must be a primary hip replacement on this hip

          -  Patient is 30 years of age or older

          -  Have hip joint disease related to one or more of the following: degenerative joint
             disease, including osteoarthritis or traumatic arthritis

          -  Patient is likely to be available for evaluation for the duration of the study

          -  Able and willing to sign the informed consent and follow study procedures

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Is younger than 30 years of age

          -  If there has been a total hip replacement on this hip in the past (no revisions
             allowed in study)

          -  Infection, or history of infection, acute or chronic, local or systemic

          -  Alcoholism or other addictions

          -  Muscular, neurological or vascular deficiencies which compromise the affected
             extremity

          -  Obesity(BMI>45)

          -  Insufficient bone quality

          -  Loss of ligamentous structures

          -  High levels of physical activity

          -  Materials sensitivity

          -  Prisoner

          -  Mental conditions that may interfere with the patient's ability to give an informed
             consent or willingness to fulfill the study requirements

          -  Patient is pregnant

          -  Is not able to read English language

intervention.description: Comparison of Iconacy I-Hip system to the Stryker Accolade hip system using a randomized study.
Comparison of Iconacy I-Hip system to the Stryker Accolade hip system using a randomized study.

primary_outcome.measure: Harris Hip Score must be > or = 80 at 2 years
Oxford Hip Score > 40 points at 2 years

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Harris Hip Score from pre-surgery to 1, 2, and 3 years
Improvements in Oxford Hip Score from pre-survey to 1, 2, and 3 years

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
